body_html: The original out= should be equivalent with .resize(*).fill_(1). Maybe we should add a note about it? I doubt many people use it though, so a deprecated version in Python is probably not needed?
body_text: The original out= should be equivalent with .resize(*).fill_(1). Maybe we should add a note about it? I doubt many people use it though, so a deprecated version in Python is probably not needed?
body: The original `out=` should be equivalent with `.resize(*).fill_(1)`. Maybe we should add a note about it? I doubt many people use it though, so a deprecated version in Python is probably not needed?
